title: Grade K
subject: Core English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2016-2024)

document.title: Iowa Core English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

F6C0E98D86264E04980BE77B003CA243.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

4C0A6DF8122B4505A7ED23FDD26D4811.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

12B8BA7DE9BB427F9AC311674ABF2C0E.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

ECE82F8E5F64412AB221F7B0EE18D82C.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

8CD34E943E2949FDBF0A8210B43BC5F7.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

03670EA9EFD74FED85B2D9D22478BDEA.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

68FF2C2F2E144AC48D47B0285370E7ED.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

D6E4208E54AB41B99DB5F5201ADCCD70.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

0B5F8ED6CDB549DFB8AE7A96EDACBA13.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

BCBD9179BCDB4548866E4CF1891860DC.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

934D81B7398E4D6694EE0DF00BDD62F7.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

07D0F4C85F38429AB8F4223E59ABCAA3.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

0ABE1AFE83064DA6A7EC90BC1562E0F1.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

89B778E9914B4CA88079F045A317166F.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

0A05D1A3AC214F4A9AAD1B193B149F59.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

59510ED094074D82A690490073BC634C.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

FEB4DEC077894B98B4C333082271600E.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

D97D37DD60D04B99856022AB04B12499.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

36AC556E12C44050A907B05C979B34F5.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

E3E76BDB8C2D41ECB4FFE74E69364639.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

F4AA65B731274BF8B572B9AC3438F4AA.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly when retelling familiar stories or reciting poems, nursery rhymes or lines of a play.

C0E412AA4D524144877CEB5573AB6B6D.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

90D484B14FA0459A8D538B5BF556F2FC.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

1FE1AA539B964E4AAB1DF207BD514263.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

0CACDEF149AE4F8CBD77E1E2F09582EE.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

046ED1BA4B824972A4A0178C2265C53E.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

5D0D20BF66374706A749117963DFDD86.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

E3AEEF6C5CB04A11BD75FF65680289C4.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

C5582ADB7D69499D8B9A6D31EEE91611.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

0228D210E2C840F8A317601EA264908C.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

DBC92DD9286D4DC5AAB1A2AA5C9625E5.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

F153EB447D064442A65F7A3186017046.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

770D8E9260204912BA1F7F01E7629233.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

69126977328C4C6E839F9DA15B2C79B9.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

5806D178F6FF45BEB122B9F68ECDA843.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

39C248430BF34D14B25E99863232AD12.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is…).

134BF59994B64C78BB3C4476B686701A.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

F3D1D5840FC14608972A1894F0396602.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

EA69670DF6594C46B879DF15088E7B4C.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

5969FA4401AE4021A4224C1BC13F0462.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

787998428D5744A79AC261939956811F.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sound for each consonant.

CAA552B3EA5641BDA3FE9CFC9920439A.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

BC66422A311748B29575113C7B2C5CB7.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

1B84E937EE104C8F91288EB9AADBA507.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/)

334B156657774622824C5F1FB09FFFE0.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

2B9B3EBE134D472CAF47796B9B6567CF.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

ED9929E542A8457A84F4A449CB35716D.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds phonemes).

0CB213EC14424B77AD7DD669099D3440.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

F6F7AE8407F14FDE83AFC5AF0F4E81B6.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

10B7BD368492432D99148BEA94B14D97.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

09A462FAA5074110A4F6C8BAB15D8170.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

5CD2B0FA42184EC5AE510AF198F227E5.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

315776F9FA1C4C2B8ACB74F9BAF7E2B7.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

4EC61702C302404E8F1A19238A50D7B3.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

6D0924460B4D452D8444D8B40A710CB8.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

6DF5E53068E34A7796E3438DFC0452A0.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

B484D88D5CFD4B7A8B88BB126409E0AE.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

FAF39839E7E544C5B1454ACF421436EF.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

E5DF0A1E7B9D40BF9979F28A2DBD3A84.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

80B6E6FD5F0145BABC3BCB35BAB071E2.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

62D7587971B34EB8A0549BD94312FE34.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

84C6800778CF4F70AEF5528D824DF0BE.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

175C21BFA47A4DC79124A9EE20E03CBD.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

F0453007D98748489D7F8C97C31F2F77.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

9D9DFE62A32740C8BC79E96FDEA4C1DD.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

8A34E53FFCF34530A58136E806B8E69B.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

D49CD36EC0EB498DA67EDECF715435C6.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

A7C78E9BD8964526BEEB2DDA1FA347C4.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

016604FDCFEC4A4F92455542EBBD39F2.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

26F72CFE3C8144EAB10AFD6F924527F7.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

E5C929E4170F4BCAA5506629CE24197D.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

0D2B3CDA651D4EBF914C68B1C0CF046D.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

3303528D687644B19DD735C9D60DA7FA.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
